executiveSummary: Brian Yenni and Earl Cole from Los Angeles pitched The Smart Tire Company, seeking $500,000 for 2.5% equity. Their company develops airless, high-performance tires made from NASAâ€™s shape-memory alloy material called NiTinol. Despite the innovative technology and a NASA partnership, the Sharks declined to invest due to high production costs, unclear business execution, and an early-stage product focus.
nextSteps: The founders plan to continue raising funds independently, finalize the rubber integration for their airless tire technology, and fulfill demand from a reported 6,000-customer waiting list.
